pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [da641d43fe](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20279/commits/da641d43fe691bf1c5100796aae81cf53c8a376d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Pi.Units` (new file)|198|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsUnit.apply`
`+ IsUnit.val_inv_apply`
`+ MulEquiv.piUnits`
`+ Pi.isUnit_iff`
`+ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

> Instead of a new file, you might consider putting these in Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Invertible/Basic.lean, e.g. [here](github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/master...MC_products_refactor#diff-7827d653f71e37d146832e87d91a281db12108a4b6dcfa640d4b64d1eea4824d).

This link doesn't work for me

Not sure what happened; [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3126fc222e5f80635f2a6e69ddc5f545c08af7de/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Invertible/Basic.lean#L170-L176) is hopefully correct. (It's actually simply the end of the file.)
I think I'm keeping the content in a new file as they does not mention `Invertible`.

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I feel that it is out of scope so I opened a separate PR for that #20432
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12597995655/job/35111996772)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12597995655/job/35111996475)

bors d+

It would be good to have `Prod.isUnit_iff` as well, but that's obviously out of scope for this PR unless you want it not to be.

Thanks! I also need this for #19042
maintainer merge

Instead of a new file, you might consider putting these in Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Invertible/Basic.lean, e.g. [here](github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/master...MC_products_refactor#diff-7827d653f71e37d146832e87d91a281db12108a4b6dcfa640d4b64d1eea4824d).

bors d+

It would be good to have `Prod.isUnit_iff` as well, but that's obviously out of scope for this PR unless you want it not to be.
Wow, didn't know this works.
This is inconsistent with `MulEquiv.prodUnits`; can we bring them in sync one way or the other?
(and similarly for the docstring)
I think they are consistent? [MulEquiv.prodUnits](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Prod.html#MulEquiv.prodUnits)
Oh sorry, you mean the name ...

```suggestion
lemma Pi.isUnit_iff :
```
to match `Filter.isUnit_iff`, `Polynomial.isUnit_iff_degree_eq_zero`, etc.

```suggestion
lemma IsUnit.val_inv_apply (hx : IsUnit x) (i : Î¹) : (hx.unitâ»Â¹).1 i = (hx.apply i).unitâ»Â¹ := by
```
nit: I think indenting wrapped docstrings is going out of fashion, but indeed we have no clear rule on it.
Sure, I have no opinion on this; fixed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Group): Units in pi types
